com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.specialized

Interface Kleisli<A,B,M extends com.jnape.palatable.lambda.monad.Monad<?,M>,MB extends com.jnape.palatable.lambda.monad.Monad<B,M>>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - the input argument type
    M - the Monad unification parameter
    MB - the output Monad type
    All Superinterfaces:
    com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Applicative<MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<A,?>>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Cartesian<A,MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<?,?>>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Cocartesian<A,MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<?,?>>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Contravariant<A,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Profunctor<?,MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<?,?>>>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<A,MB>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Functor<MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<A,?>>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.monad.Monad<MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<A,?>>, com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functor.Profunctor<A,MB,com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<?,?>>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Kleisli<A,B,M extends com.jnape.palatable.lambda.monad.Monad<?,M>,MB extends com.jnape.palatable.lambda.monad.Monad<B,M>>
extends com.jnape.palatable.lambda.functions.Fn1<A,MB>
    The Kleisli arrow of a Monad, manifest as simply an Fn1<A, MB>. This can be thought of as a fixed, portable Monad.flatMap(Fn1).

        Sequence both this Applicative and appB, discarding appB's result and returning this Applicative. This is generally useful for sequentially performing side-effects.
